what: Load Columbia County HUC12 watersheds layer from Geoserver
title: nrcs-practices
nrcs-practices
text: Dataset provided SCC many unique watersheds file? Warning: Practice code 430 > 1 practice names . Filter NRCS data include HUC12 Columbia County many Huc12s Columbia County?
code: data_path <- system.file("extdata", "20040101-20240430 NRCS Practices_edited_v3.xlsx", package = "middlesnake")  nrcs_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(data_path) %>%   janitor::clean_names() nrcs_data %>%     pull(huc12) %>%     unique() %>%     length() #> [1] 1289 nrcs_data %>%     cnt(practice_code,n_distinct_vars = practice_name) %>%     filter(n_practice_name>1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   practice_code n_practice_name     n n_cumulative #>   <chr>                   <int> <int>        <int> #> 1 430                         2  1106       105975 nrcs_data %>%     filter(practice_code==430) %>%     distinct(practice_name) #> # A tibble: 2 × 1 #>   practice_name               #>   <chr>                       #> 1 Irrigation Pipeline         #> 2 Irrigation Water Conveyance nrcs_columbia <-  nrcs_data %>%   filter(huc12 %in% columbia_huc12s$huc12 ) %>%   rename(same_code=land_unit_has_multiple_instances_of_same_practice_code,          same_code_and_year=land_unit_has_multiple_instances_of_same_practice_code_applied_the_same_year) nrcs_columbia %>%   cnt(n_distinct_vars = huc12) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   n_huc12     n n_cumulative #>     <int> <int>        <int> #> 1      36 13516        13516

title: nrcs-practices
text: practice code applied multiple times land unit year, data likely duplicated removed summing applied amounts -NRCS Conservation Practices Data: Overview FAQs Oct-2024 land_unit_id 1 distinct huc12 Columbia County Columbia County 9084 distinct records land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code Check distinct records land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code match distinct applied_amount, land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code listings
code: nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(land_unit_id,n_distinct_vars = huc12) %>%    filter(n_huc12>1) #> # A tibble: 0 × 4 #> # ℹ 4 variables: land_unit_id <chr>, n_huc12 <int>, n <int>, n_cumulative <int> nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(n_distinct_vars = c(land_unit_id,applied_year,practice_code)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   n_land_unit_id n_applied_year n_practice_code n_land_unit_id_applied_y…¹     n #>            <int>          <int>           <int>                      <int> <int> #> 1           2408             21             112                       9084 13516 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​n_land_unit_id_applied_year_practice_code #> # ℹ 1 more variable: n_cumulative <int> nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(n_distinct_vars = c(land_unit_id,applied_amount,applied_year,practice_code)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   n_land_unit_id n_applied_amount n_applied_year n_practice_code #>            <int>            <int>          <int>           <int> #> 1           2408             1146             21             112 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: #> #   n_land_unit_id_applied_amount_applied_year_practice_code <int>, n <int>, #> #   n_cumulative <int> duplicated_practices <- nrcs_columbia %>%     group_by(land_unit_id,practice_code,applied_year) %>%     mutate(duplicates_id_yr_code=1:n()) %>%     ungroup() %>%     group_by(land_unit_id,practice_code,applied_year,applied_amount) %>%     mutate(duplicates_id_yr_code_amt=1:n()) %>%     ungroup() ids_where_amt_is_different <- duplicated_practices %>%      filter(duplicates_id_yr_code>1) %>%      filter(!duplicates_id_yr_code==duplicates_id_yr_code_amt) %>%      pull(land_unit_id) %>%      unique() duplicated_listings <- duplicated_practices %>%     filter(land_unit_id %in% ids_where_amt_is_different) %>%     select(land_unit_id,practice_name,applied_amount,applied_date,applied_year,starts_with("dup"), program) %>%     arrange(land_unit_id,applied_year)%>%     split(~land_unit_id)

title: nrcs-practices
text: Note: Consider applied_amount program removing/collapsing duplicates land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code

what: Get the layer that need summarized
title: summarize-layer-by-huc12
text: use frequently flooded areas
code: flooded <- get_geoserver_layer("columbia-frequently-flooded") #> ℹ Attempting to download vector layer "columbia-frequently-flooded" via WFS #> ✔ Layer downloaded: 131 features.

title: summarize-layer-by-huc12
text: many frequently flooded acres inside huc 12 watershed Columbia County? returns huc12 (numeric code) acres. want watershed name add
code: columbia_flooded_huc12 <- summarize_acres_by_huc12(huc12 = columbia_huc12,                                                    overlay = flooded) #> ℹ Validating geometries... #> ℹ Performing spatial intersection... #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout #> all geometries #> ℹ Summarizing by "huc12"... #> ✔ Acre summary complete. columbia_flooded_huc12 %>%     dplyr::left_join(columbia_huc12 %>%                         select(name,huc12)                      ) #> Joining with `by = join_by(huc12)` #> # A tibble: 35 × 4 #>    huc12        acres name                                              geometry #>    <chr>        <dbl> <chr>                                        <POLYGON [°]> #>  1 170601070807 1676. Flagpole Gulch-Snake River       ((-118.0089 46.55987, -1… #>  2 170601070608 1437. Town of Marengo-Tucannon River   ((-117.7862 46.46699, -1… #>  3 170601070808  995. Choke Cherry Spring-Snake River  ((-118.0268 46.58357, -1… #>  4 170701020401  801. Payne Hollow-Touchet River       ((-117.9852 46.31925, -1… #>  5 170701020501  766. Upper Whetstone Hollow           ((-117.7978 46.37677, -1… #>  6 170601070804  653. Town of Central Ferry-Snake Riv… ((-117.8523 46.61019, -1… #>  7 170601070606  525. Hartsock Grade-Tucannon River    ((-117.6807 46.3813, -11… #>  8 170701020304  493. South Fork Touchet River         ((-117.9051 46.27083, -1… #>  9 170701020303  412. Wolf Fork                        ((-117.8324 46.18208, -1… #> 10 170701020402  406. Whiskey Creek                    ((-117.9633 46.21827, -1… #> # ℹ 25 more rows

title: summarize-layer-by-huc12
code: wetlands <- get_geoserver_layer("columbia-wetlands") #> ℹ Attempting to download vector layer "columbia-wetlands" via WFS #> ✔ Layer downloaded: 618 features.

what: This time we want to stratify by wetland type within each huc 12
title: summarize-layer-by-huc12
text: ’ll set group_vars argument
code: columbia_wetlands_huc12 <- summarize_acres_by_huc12(huc12 = columbia_huc12,overlay = wetlands,group_vars = "WETLAND_TY") #> ℹ Validating geometries... #> ℹ Performing spatial intersection... #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout #> all geometries #> ℹ Summarizing by "huc12, WETLAND_TY"... #> ✔ Acre summary complete.  columbia_wetlands_huc12 #> # A tibble: 90 × 3 #>    huc12        WETLAND_TY                         acres #>    <chr>        <chr>                              <dbl> #>  1 170601070807 Lake                              1525.  #>  2 170601070808 Lake                               924.  #>  3 170601070804 Lake                               617.  #>  4 170601070704 Freshwater Forested/Shrub Wetland   98.2 #>  5 170601070608 Freshwater Forested/Shrub Wetland   89.1 #>  6 170601100102 Lake                                84.0 #>  7 170701020401 Freshwater Forested/Shrub Wetland   83.6 #>  8 170701020401 Riverine                            73.8 #>  9 170601070608 Freshwater Emergent Wetland         68.0 #> 10 170601070701 Freshwater Forested/Shrub Wetland   54.1 #> # ℹ 80 more rows

what: Use a layer not on Geoserver
title: summarize-layer-by-huc12
text: already Columbia watersheds use aoi (.e. Area Interest) automatically subset layer grabbing. example using WA DNR Priority areas.
code: dnr_forest_priority <- get_gis_from_url(url = "https://services.arcgis.com/4x406oNViizbGo13/arcgis/rest/services/Eastern_WA_Forest_Health_Priority_HUC6_Watersheds/FeatureServer/0/query?where=1%3D1&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=geojson",aoi = columbia_huc12) #> ℹ Requesting GIS data from <https://services.arcgis.com/4x406oNViizbGo13/arcgis/rest/services/Eastern_WA_Forest_Health_Priority_HUC6_Watersheds/FeatureServer/0/query?where=1%3D1&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=geojson&geometry=-118.242296322747,45.999086548544,-117.603296305266,46.6246534152626&geometryType=esriGeometryEnvelope&inSR=4326&spatialRel=esriSpatialRelIntersects> #> ✔ Parsed 38 features from GeoJSON. columbia_forest_priority_huc12 <- summarize_acres_by_huc12(huc12 = columbia_huc12,                                                             overlay = dnr_forest_priority) #> ℹ Validating geometries... #> ℹ Performing spatial intersection... #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout #> all geometries #> ℹ Summarizing by "huc12"... #> ✔ Acre summary complete.

what: Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
title: Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
text: function intersects HUC12 watersheds Water Resource Inventory Areas (WRIAs) assigns HUC12 WRIA overlaps area. input layers transformed EPSG:5070 (NAD83 / Conus Albers) accurate area calculation.

title: Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
text: huc12_sf sf object HUC12 polygons. Must include numeric column HUC12 values. wria_sf sf object WRIA polygons. huc_id_col Character name HUC12 ID column (e.g., "huc12"). huc_name_col Character name HUC12 watershed

title: Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
text: data.frame

title: Assign Each HUC12 Watershed to Its Dominant WRIA — assign_wria_to_huc12
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ huc12_wria_table <- assign_wria_to_huc12(   huc12_sf = huc12_layer,   wria_sf = wria_layer,   huc_id_col = "huc12",   huc_name_col = "name" )  # Join to spatial layer huc12_with_wria <- dplyr::left_join(huc12_layer, huc12_wria_table, by = "HUC12") } # }

what: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: function reads Excel file containing NRCS practice data, standardizes column names, checks whether user-supplied HUC12 watershed codes present, flags duplicated practice entries, returns cleaned, dataset total applied amounts per group.

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: dataset_path character string indicating path .xlsx Excel file read. huc_12_codes character vector HUC12 watershed codes verify dataset.

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: data.frame containing: Cleaned standardized variable names Duplicate detection variables: duplicates_id_yr_code, duplicates_id_yr_code_amt Duplicated rows, representing unique land_unit_id–practice_code–applied_year applied_amount updated reflect total grouped duplicates

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: Duplicate records defined two stages: land_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year (duplicates_id_yr_code) fields plus applied_amount (duplicates_id_yr_code_amt) applied_amount  different values sameland_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year, applied_amount summed applied_amount  multiple values land_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year, records considered true duplicates removed original dataset names cleaned lowercase snake_case using janitor::clean_names().

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data

title: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL, with optional AOI — get_gis_from_url
text: url Character. full ArcGIS REST API query URL returning GeoJSON (must include f=geojson f=json). save_as Optional character. Base file name (without extension) save result Shapefile. Optional character. SQL-like clause filter features (e.g., "County = 'Columbia'"). aoi Optional sf polygon. supplied, calculates envelope spatial filtering.

what: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
text: function downloads Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) HUC polygons given county Washington clips HUC polygon conservation district provided. Optionally saves results shapefile. Clipped acres watershed automatically recalculated added Acres_in_huc variable

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
code: get_huc_by_cd(   district_name,   huc_level = "huc12",   save_shp = FALSE,   shp_path = NULL )

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
text: district_name Character. Name district (e.g., "Columbia"). huc_level Character. One "huc02" "huc04" "huc06" "huc08" "huc10" "huc12" "huc12_nhdplusv2" save_shp Logical. Whether save result shapefile. Default FALSE. shp_path Character. File path save shapefile (without extension). Default NULL.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
text: sf object watershed polygons assigned input county.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by Conservation District — get_huc_by_cd
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   asotin_huc12s <- get_huc_by_cd("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12")    leaflet() %>%   addTiles() %>%   addPolygons(data=asotin_huc12s,label=~name)   get_huc_by_cd("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12",  save_shp = TRUE,  shp_path = "../../../Documents/asotin_huc12_clipped")  } # }

what: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
text: county_name Character. Name county (e.g., "Columbia"). huc_level Character. One "huc8", "huc10", "huc12". Default "huc12". save_shp Logical. Whether save result shapefile. Default FALSE. shp_path Character. File path save shapefile (without extension). Default NULL.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
text: sf object watershed polygons assigned input county.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   asotin_huc12s <- get_huc_by_county("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12")    leaflet() %>%   addTiles() %>%   addPolygons(data=asotin_huc12s,label=~name)   get_huc_by_county("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12",  save_shp = TRUE,  shp_path = "../../../Documents/asotin_huc12_clipped")  } # }

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county
text: sf object SWIFD features clipped specified counties.

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county
text: function: Uses {tigris} get Washington county boundaries. Downloads full SWIFD dataset GeoJSON format via {httr}. Parses JSON using {geojsonsf}. Clips union selected counties, applying small buffer capture stream overlaps. Optionally writes result disk Shapefile.

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county

what: Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers
title: Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers
text: function queries GeoServer WMS GetCapabilities endpoint extracts list available WMS layer names. default, points Columbia County WA workspace.

title: Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers
Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers
text: capabilities_url character string specifying WMS GetCapabilities URL. Defaults Columbia workspace GeoServer: "http://142.93.92.104:8080/geoserver/Columbia/wms?service=WMS&version=1.1.0&request=GetCapabilities"

title: Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers
text: character vector layer names (e.g., "Columbia:usda_2024_cropland").

title: Get List of Layers from Columbia GeoServer — show_geoserver_layers

what: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: Summarize Acres Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
code: summarize_acres_by_huc12(   huc12,   overlay,   huc_id_col = "huc12",   group_vars = NULL )

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: huc12 sf object representing HUC12 watersheds overlay sf object representing layers summarized (e.g., wetlands) overlay polygon calculates acres, point just returns count huc_id_col name column identifying HUC12 unit (default: "huc12") group_vars Optional character vector additional grouping columns overlay layer (e.g., c("wetland_type"))

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: data frame summarizing acres HUC12 optional groupings

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  huc12 <- get_geoserver_layer("all_columbia_huc_12s") geohazards <- get_geoserver_layer("columbia-geologic-hazard")  geohaz_acres <- summarize_acres_by_huc12(huc12 = huc12, overlay = geohazards, group_vars = "forpehrtdc") } # }

title: Summarize Crop Types Within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_crops_by_huc12

Summarize Crop Types Within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_crops_by_huc12
text: crops_rast SpatRaster object representing crop types (e.g., CDL) huc12 sf object HUC12 watershed boundaries unique "name" column

title: Summarize Crop Types Within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_crops_by_huc12
text: tibble columns: ID, name, crop, crop_name, n_pixels, acres
